intro: Ptyssiglottis debilis, commonly known as the slender lily, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the temperate regions of the southern hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it suitable for rock gardens or woodland borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate appearance and ease of cultivation.
